document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the endemic Hawaiian genus Thyrocopa (Lepidoptera: Xyloryctidae: Xyloryctinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the endemic Hawaiian genus Thyrocopa (Lepidoptera: Xyloryctidae: Xyloryctinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Lectotype : UNITED STATES : HAWAII: Maui : Haleakala, 4000 ’ [ 1219 m ]: 1 3 (slide 4048 BMNH ), 1881 , Blackburn(?) ( BMNH ), designated by
Zimmerman, 1978
: figs. 658, 674 (as “ holotype ”).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Thyrocopa gigas (Butler)
;
Walsingham, 1907 b
: 493
, plate 14 , fig. 7 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis :
Thyrocopa gigas
is among the largest species in the genus. It is rivaled in size only by
T. cinerella
,
T. decipiens
,
T. kea
, and
T. megas
.
Thyrocopa gigas
is almost always larger than any of these species except for
T. decipiens
, but unlike
T. decipiens
, the male antennae of
T. gigas
are filiform.
Thyrocopa gigas
is much darker in color than any of the above species except for
T. decipiens
.

Distribution : Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, Maui. However,
T. gigas
is possibly extinct on Oahu, where two females were collected by Perkins in 1892 but no further specimens have been collected since then.
